intro: Sida oblonga, commonly known as broadleaf sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Americas and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, pale flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in wetlands and along stream banks. Sida oblonga has a fibrous root system and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species.
